SDK Installation

Send comments on this topic.
The FlashFX Tera Kit includes all the source code, header files, utility programs, and data files that are needed to create a FlashFX Tera device driver that is customized for your specific operating system, flash array, and target hardware. In most cases, the distribution method of FlashFX Tera is a compressed zip file containing a setup program. In some cases a CD-ROM may be provide. To install the kit from a CD-ROM, place the distribution CD-ROM in the CD drive on any Windows 2000 or later system, and run SETUP.EXE.

For an electronic distribution, extract the contents of the zip file to a location of your choosing and run the SETUP.EXE installer.

The installation program creates the directory tree and copies all the necessary files to the hard disk. Additionally, the installation process creates several Windows shortcuts to the FlashFX Tera development environment. It is recommended that the default installation path be used to ensure compatibility with other Datalight products.

Please review the readme.txt file to learn of any last minute changes or updates that were not available at the time this manual was published.

Installing License Keys

Note --Until License Keys are applied, FlashFX Tera will operate in an evaluation mode which will limit the FlashFX Tera disk size. All functions are operational, however the maximim size of a Disk will be limited to 1/4 the Device size.

License Keys are obtained from Datalight at the time of kit purchase. The license keys are applied through #DEFINEs within the file ffxconf.h. Create the following entries at the end of header file with the values provided by Datalight: 

        +-----------------------------------------------------+
        |                                                     |
        |  /*  License Keys for Full Functionality            |
        |  */                                                 |
        |  #define FFX_LICENSE_ID        ############         |
        |  #define FFX_ACTIVATION_KEY    ############         |
        |                                                     |
        +-----------------------------------------------------+

Obtaining Core Source

Under the default delivery of FlashFX Tera, source code to core functionality is provided within obfuscated source code (that is compilable but not human readable). Core source kits may be purchased from Datalight. The core source kit installs over the existing installation. With core source installed, the license keys are no longer necessary to utilize the full flash array.

Installation on Non-Windows Host Systems

Regardless of the host and target environments, the FlashFX Tera Kit is provided for use on Win32 environments. The files, after installing into a Win32 environment may then be copied onto the non-Windows hosted development system.

Some systems differ in their translations of carriage return and linefeed characters inserted at the end of each line in text files. If the target system translates these characters differently than Windows, a utility may be needed to change each line to use the appropriate character sequence.

Please contact Datalight support for advice and assistance if you are building FlashFX Tera on a non-Windows hosted development system such as Linux or Solaris.

SDK Layout

In installed FlashFX SDK have a directory structure similar to that shown below.

The diagram show above uses mixed case names for the purpose of readability, however the actual directory names are lower case.

Note -- Some kits may contain slight variations in the directory structure, particularly within the OS tree.

FlashFX Tera typically comes with built in support for a number of common reference platforms. This code will reside in the projects directory tree. See the readme.txt file for more information about these preconfigured projects.
